meanings.definition: To sign (a document already signed by another) in order to validate or confirm it.
meanings.sent1: She was countersigning the contract to make it official.
meanings.sent2: The manager will need to countersign the approval form.
meanings.sent3: The cat was countersigning the adoption papers with a paw print.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like countersigning the sky with sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's red pen countersigning the test paper was a mark of approval.

meanings.definition: A signature added to a document already signed by another, in order to validate or confirm it.
meanings.sent1: Please make sure to include the countersigning on the form.
meanings.sent2: The document is not valid without the necessary countersigning.
meanings.sent3: The countersigning on the painting was actually a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a bright countersigning on the dull document.
meanings.sent5: The missing countersigning caused a delay in processing the paperwork.
